main event: Multiple military personnel observed an unusual aerial object over Neubiburg, Germany on October 11, 1951. The object was described as a circular, brilliant white light larger and much brighter than a star, which displayed erratic movements before disappearing from view.
interesting points: The object was observed to be stationary for approximately one minute before moving rapidly in a straight line, then stopping and moving slowly in an erratic course.
Witnesses reported the object hovering or moving at an extremely slow rate, exhibiting behavior that did not conform to normal flight patterns of known aircraft.
The observed object appeared as an egg-shaped, brilliantly illuminated entity, emitting light from within, and was estimated to be several thousand feet in altitude.
Some witnesses described the object as metallic with a dark center, while others likened it to a flying disc.
Despite thorough investigation by Air Force authorities, no concrete conclusions were reached regarding the nature of the observed object.
sighted object: Circular, brilliant white light displaying erratic movements
photographs: No photographs included in the report
